text:
In our case we are running multiple Apache instances as same user account on the same server. if one instance is up and running then not able to start 2nd instance.

using
OS : RHEL
Apache version   : 2.4.23
Apr version      : 1.5.2
Apr-util version : 1.5.4 

errors reporting in error_log

[Tue Jan 03 14:08:13.344168 2017] [ssl:warn] [pid 21826:tid 140190192838400] AH01873: Init: Session Cache is not configured [hint: SSLSessionCache]
[Tue Jan 03 14:08:13.572853 2017] [mpm_event:notice] [pid 21826:tid 140190192838400] AH00489: Apache/2.4.23 (Unix) OpenSSL/1.0.1e-fips PHP/5.6.27 configured -- resuming normal operations
[Tue Jan 03 14:08:13.572886 2017] [core:notice] [pid 21826:tid 140190192838400] AH00094: Command line: '/usr/apache24/bin/httpd -f /usr/apache242/conf/httpd.conf'
[Tue Jan 03 14:12:26.208007 2017] [slotmem_shm:error] [pid 21955:tid 139698414905088] AH02599: existing shared memory for /usr/apache24/logs/slotmem-shm-p81c08e45.shm could not be used (failed size check)
[Tue Jan 03 14:12:26.208025 2017] [proxy_balancer:emerg] [pid 21955:tid 139698414905088] (22)Invalid argument: AH01179: balancer slotmem_create failed
[Tue Jan 03 14:12:26.208042 2017] [:emerg] [pid 21955:tid 139698414905088] AH00020: Configuration Failed, exiting.
creator: mahi4422@gmail.com

text:
Hello Mahi,

This appears to be a user setup problem rather than an error in the Apache HTTP Server code.
Perhaps you should try asking this on the Apache httpd user mailing list.
- http://httpd.apache.org/userslist.html

It would also be helpful if you were to give more detail on how you are distinguishing one Apache instance from the other.
It looks like you are trying to use some of the same files for each instance.
creator: mike.rumph@oracle.com
